javawars
Class ErisMessage

java.lang.Object
  javawars.ErisMessage

public final class ErisMessage
extends java.lang.Object

Method Summary
 int[][] getElevationMap()
          Returns the two-dimensional array of integers which describe the height of corresponding fields on board.
 int[][] getGemMap()
          Returns the two-dimensional array of integers which describe the value of gems located on the corresponding field on board; 0 means 'no gem'
 int getMyId()
          Returns the ID of the robot accessing the ErisMessage object.
 java.awt.Point getMyPosition()
          Returns the position of the robot
 int[][] getRobotMap()
          Returns the two-dimensional array of integers which contain ID's of the robot that occupies the corresponding field.

public int getMyId()
Returns the ID of the robot accessing the ErisMessage object.

getMyPosition

public java.awt.Point getMyPosition()
Returns the position of the robot

Returns:
java.awt.Point object, whose .x and .y attributes represent the robot's position on the board

getElevationMap

public int[][] getElevationMap()
Returns the two-dimensional array of integers which describe the height of corresponding fields on board.

Returns:

getGemMap

public int[][] getGemMap()
Returns the two-dimensional array of integers which describe the value of gems located on the corresponding field on board; 0 means 'no gem'

Returns:

getRobotMap

public int[][] getRobotMap()
Returns the two-dimensional array of integers which contain ID's of the robot that occupies the corresponding field. To know its own ID, robot may invoke the getMyId() method on ErisMessage object.

Returns:
